inclusionType.name: CommonClientConfiguration

memberTypes.name: subProtocols
memberTypes.description: Negotiable sub protocols of the client

memberTypes.name: customHeaders
memberTypes.description: Custom headers, which should be sent to the server

memberTypes.name: readTimeout
memberTypes.description: Read timeout (in seconds) of the client

memberTypes.name: writeTimeout
memberTypes.description: Write timeout (in seconds) of the client

memberTypes.name: secureSocket
memberTypes.description: SSL/TLS-related options

memberTypes.name: maxFrameSize
memberTypes.description:
The maximum payload size of a WebSocket frame in bytes.
If this is not set, is negative, or is zero, the default frame size of 65536 will be used

memberTypes.name: webSocketCompressionEnabled
memberTypes.description: Enable support for compression in the WebSocket

memberTypes.name: handShakeTimeout
memberTypes.description:
Time (in seconds) that a connection waits to get the response of
the WebSocket handshake. If the timeout exceeds, then the connection is terminated with
an error. If the value < 0, then the value sets to the default value(300)

memberTypes.name: cookies
memberTypes.description: An Array of `http:Cookie`

memberTypes.name: auth
memberTypes.description: Configurations related to client authentication

memberTypes.name: pingPongHandler
memberTypes.description:
A service to handle the ping/pong frames.
Resources in this service gets called on the receipt of ping/pong frames from the server

memberTypes.name: retryConfig
memberTypes.description: Retry related configurations.

records.name: ClientConfiguration
records.description:
Configurations for the WebSocket client.
The following fields are inherited from the other configuration records in addition to the client-specific configs.                    |

inclusionType.name: ClientSecureSocket
inclusionType.description: Provides configurations for facilitating secure communication with a remote HTTP endpoint.

memberTypes.name: enable
memberTypes.description: Enable SSL validation

memberTypes.name: cert
memberTypes.description: Configurations associated with `crypto:TrustStore` or single certificate file that the client trusts

memberTypes.name: key
memberTypes.description: Configurations associated with `crypto:KeyStore` or combination of certificate and private key of the client

memberTypes.name: protocol
memberTypes.description: SSL/TLS protocol related options

elementType.description: Provides configurations for facilitating secure communication with a remote HTTP endpoint.

memberTypes.name: certValidation
memberTypes.description: Certificate validation against OCSP_CRL, OCSP_STAPLING related options

elementType.description: Provides configurations for facilitating secure communication with a remote HTTP endpoint.

memberTypes.name: ciphers
memberTypes.description:
List of ciphers to be used
eg: TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA

memberTypes.name: verifyHostName
memberTypes.description: Enable/disable host name verification

memberTypes.name: shareSession
memberTypes.description: Enable/disable new SSL session creation

memberTypes.name: handshakeTimeout
memberTypes.description: SSL handshake time out

memberTypes.name: sessionTimeout
memberTypes.description: SSL session time out

records.description: Configures the SSL/TLS options to be used for WebSocket client.

inclusionType.name: LdapUserStoreConfig
inclusionType.description: Represents the LDAP user store configurations.

memberTypes.name: domainName
memberTypes.description: Unique name to identify the user store

memberTypes.name: connectionUrl
memberTypes.description: Connection URL of the LDAP server

memberTypes.name: connectionName
memberTypes.description: The username used to connect to the LDAP server

memberTypes.name: connectionPassword
memberTypes.description: The password used to connect to the LDAP server

memberTypes.name: userSearchBase
memberTypes.description: DN of the context or object under which the user entries are stored in the LDAP server

memberTypes.name: userEntryObjectClass
memberTypes.description: Object class used to construct user entries

memberTypes.name: userNameAttribute
memberTypes.description: The attribute used for uniquely identifying a user entry

memberTypes.name: userNameSearchFilter
memberTypes.description: Filtering criteria used to search for a particular user entry

memberTypes.name: userNameListFilter
memberTypes.description: Filtering criteria for searching user entries in the LDAP server

memberTypes.name: groupSearchBase
memberTypes.description: DN of the context or object under which the group entries are stored in the LDAP server

memberTypes.name: groupEntryObjectClass
memberTypes.description: Object class used to construct group entries

memberTypes.name: groupNameAttribute
memberTypes.description: The attribute used for uniquely identifying a group entry

memberTypes.name: groupNameSearchFilter
memberTypes.description: Filtering criteria used to search for a particular group entry

memberTypes.name: groupNameListFilter
memberTypes.description: Filtering criteria for searching group entries in the LDAP server

memberTypes.name: membershipAttribute
memberTypes.description: Define the attribute, which contains the distinguished names (DN) of user objects that are there in a group

memberTypes.name: userRolesCacheEnabled
memberTypes.description: To indicate whether to cache the role list of a user

memberTypes.name: connectionPoolingEnabled
memberTypes.description: Define whether LDAP connection pooling is enabled

memberTypes.name: connectionTimeout
memberTypes.description: Connection timeout (in seconds) when making the initial LDAP connection

memberTypes.name: readTimeout
memberTypes.description: Reading timeout (in seconds) for LDAP operations

memberTypes.name: secureSocket
memberTypes.description: The SSL configurations for the LDAP client socket. This needs to be configured in order to communicate through LDAPs

The SSL configurations for the service endpoint. This needs to be configured in order to

Period of time in seconds that a connection waits for a read/write operation in the
initial upgrade request. Use value 0 to disable timeout

records.name: ListenerConfiguration
records.description: Provides a set of configurations for HTTP service endpoints.

inclusionType.name: ListenerHttp1Settings
inclusionType.description: Provides settings related to HTTP/1.x protocol.

memberTypes.name: keepAlive
memberTypes.description:
Can be set to either `KEEPALIVE_AUTO`, which respects the `connection` header, or `KEEPALIVE_ALWAYS`,
which always keeps the connection alive, or `KEEPALIVE_NEVER`, which always closes the connection

memberTypes.name: maxPipelinedRequests
memberTypes.description:
Defines the maximum number of requests that can be processed at a given time on a single
connection. By default 10 requests can be pipelined on a single connection and user can
change this limit appropriately.

records.name: ListenerHttp1Settings
records.description: Provides settings related to HTTP/1.x protocol.

inclusionType.name: RequestLimitConfigs
inclusionType.description: Provides inbound request URI, total header and entity body size threshold configurations.

memberTypes.name: maxUriLength
memberTypes.description:
Maximum allowed length for a URI. Exceeding this limit will result in a `414 - URI Too Long`
response

memberTypes.name: maxHeaderSize
memberTypes.description:
Maximum allowed size for headers. Exceeding this limit will result in a
`431 - Request Header Fields Too Large` response

memberTypes.name: maxEntityBodySize
memberTypes.description:
Maximum allowed size for the entity body. By default it is set to -1 which means there
is no restriction `maxEntityBodySize`, On the Exceeding this limit will result in a
`413 - Payload Too Large` response

records.name: RequestLimitConfigs
records.description: Provides inbound request URI, total header and entity body size threshold configurations.

fields.name: maxCount
fields.description: The maximum number of retry attempts. If the count is zero, the client will retry indefinitely.

fields.name: interval
fields.description: The number of seconds to delay before attempting to reconnect.

fields.name: backOffFactor
fields.description:
The rate of increase of the reconnect delay. Allows reconnect attempts to back off when problems
persist.

fields.name: maxWaitInterval
fields.description: Maximum time of the retry interval in seconds.

records.name: WebSocketRetryConfig
records.description: Retry configurations for WebSocket.

fields.name: subProtocols
fields.description: Negotiable sub protocol by the service

fields.name: idleTimeout
fields.description:
Idle timeout for the client connection. Upon timeout, `onIdleTimeout` resource (if defined)
in the server service will be triggered. Note that this overrides the `timeout` config
in the `websocket:Listener` which is applicable only for the initial HTTP upgrade request.

fields.name: maxFrameSize
fields.description:
The maximum payload size of a WebSocket frame in bytes.
If this is not set or is negative or zero, the default frame size which is 65536 will be used.

fields.name: auth
fields.description: Listener authenticaton configurations

records.name: WSServiceConfig
records.description: Configurations for a WebSocket service.

objectTypes.name: PingPongService
objectTypes.description: The WebSocket service type to handle ping/pong frames

returnParameters.description: A `websocket:Error` if an error occurs when sending

remoteMethods.name: writeTextMessage
remoteMethods.description:
Pushes text messages to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the text message to the connection, that message
will be lost.

returnParameters.description: A `websocket:Error` if an error occurs when sending

remoteMethods.name: writeBinaryMessage
remoteMethods.description:
Pushes binary data to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the binary message to the connection,
that message will be lost.

returnParameters.description: A `websocket:Error` if an error occurs when sending

remoteMethods.name: ping
remoteMethods.description: Pings the connection. If an error occurs while sending the ping frame to the server, that frame will be lost.

returnParameters.description: A `websocket:Error` if an error occurs when sending

remoteMethods.name: pong
remoteMethods.description:
Sends a pong message to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the pong frame to the connection, that
the frame will be lost.

parameters.name: statusCode
parameters.description: Status code for closing the connection

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description:
Time to wait (in seconds) for the close frame to be received from the remote endpoint before closing the
connection. If the timeout exceeds, then the connection is terminated even though a close frame
is not received from the remote endpoint. If the value < 0 (e.g., -1), then the connection waits
until a close frame is received. If the WebSocket frame is received from the remote endpoint
within the waiting period, the connection is terminated immediately.

returnParameters.description: A `websocket:Error` if an error occurs when sending
A `websocket:Error` if an error occurs when sending

methods.name: writeTextMessage
methods.description:
Pushes text messages to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the text message to the connection, that message
will be lost.

returnParameters.description: A `websocket:Error` if an error occurs when sending

methods.name: writeBinaryMessage
methods.description:
Pushes binary data to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the binary message to the connection,
that message will be lost.

returnParameters.description: A `websocket:Error` if an error occurs when sending

methods.name: ping
methods.description: Pings the connection. If an error occurs while sending the ping frame to the server, that frame will be lost.

returnParameters.description: A `websocket:Error` if an error occurs when sending

methods.name: pong
methods.description:
Sends a pong message to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the pong frame to the connection, that
the frame will be lost.

parameters.name: statusCode
parameters.description: Status code for closing the connection

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description:
Time to wait (in seconds) for the close frame to be received from the remote endpoint before closing the
connection. If the timeout exceeds, then the connection is terminated even though a close frame
is not received from the remote endpoint. If the value < 0 (e.g., -1), then the connection waits
until a close frame is received. If the WebSocket frame is received from the remote endpoint
within the waiting period, the connection is terminated immediately.

returnParameters.description: A `websocket:Error` if an error occurs when sending

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes the connection.

returnParameters.description: `true` if the connection is open

methods.description: Gives the open or closed status of the connection.

remoteMethods.description:
Sends a pong message to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the pong frame to the connection, that
the frame will be lost.

parameters.name: statusCode
parameters.description: Status code for closing the connection

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description:
Time to wait (in seconds) for the close frame to be received from the remote endpoint before closing the
connection. If the timeout exceeds, then the connection is terminated even though a close frame
is not received from the remote endpoint. If the value is < 0 (e.g., -1), then the connection
waits until a close frame is received. If the WebSocket frame is received from the remote
endpoint within the waiting period, the connection is terminated immediately.

returnParameters.description: A `websocket:Error` if an error occurs while closing the WebSocket connection

returnParameters.description: The binary data sent by the server or an `websocket:Error` if an error occurs when receiving

remoteMethods.name: readBinaryMessage
remoteMethods.description: Reads binary data in a synchronous manner

returnParameters.description:
A `string` if a text message is received, `byte[]` if a binary message is received or a `websocket:Error`
if an error occurs when receiving

remoteMethods.name: readMessage
remoteMethods.description: Reads data from the WebSocket connection

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: The configurations to be used when initializing the client

methods.name: init
methods.description: Initializes the synchronous client when called.

returnParameters.description: A `websocket:Error` if an error occurs when sending

methods.name: writeTextMessage
methods.description:
Writes text messages to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the text message to the connection, that message
will be lost.

returnParameters.description: A `websocket:Error` if an error occurs when sending

methods.name: writeBinaryMessage
methods.description:
Writes binary data to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the binary message to the connection,
that message will be lost.

returnParameters.description: A `websocket:Error` if an error occurs when sending

methods.name: ping
methods.description: Pings the connection. If an error occurs while sending the ping frame to the server, that frame will be lost.

returnParameters.description: A `websocket:Error` if an error occurs when sending

methods.name: pong
methods.description:
Sends a pong message to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the pong frame to the connection, that
the frame will be lost.

parameters.name: statusCode
parameters.description: Status code for closing the connection

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description:
Time to wait (in seconds) for the close frame to be received from the remote endpoint before closing the
connection. If the timeout exceeds, then the connection is terminated even though a close frame
is not received from the remote endpoint. If the value is < 0 (e.g., -1), then the connection
waits until a close frame is received. If the WebSocket frame is received from the remote
endpoint within the waiting period, the connection is terminated immediately.

returnParameters.description: A `websocket:Error` if an error occurs while closing the WebSocket connection

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes the connection.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key, which identifies the attribute

methods.name: setAttribute

returnParameters.description: The attribute related to the given key or `nil`

returnParameters.description: `true` if the connection is secure

methods.name: isSecure

returnParameters.description: `true` if the connection is open

listeners.name: Listener
listeners.description:
This is used for creating WebSocket server endpoints. A WebSocket server endpoint is capable of responding to
remote callers. The `Listener` is responsible for initializing the endpoint using the provided configurations.

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: Represents the cookies to be added

functions.name: addCookies
functions.description: Adds cookies to the custom header.

parameters.name: serviceRef
parameters.description: The service reference where the resource locates

functions.name: authenticateResource
functions.description:
Uses for declarative auth design, where the authentication/authorization decision is taken
by reading the auth annotations provided in service/resource and the `Authorization` header of request.

constants.name: AUTH_SCHEME_BASIC
constants.description: The prefix used to denote the Basic authentication scheme.

constants.name: AUTH_SCHEME_BEARER
constants.description: The prefix used to denote the Bearer authentication scheme.

annotations.name: ServiceConfig
annotations.description: The annotation which is used to configure a WebSocket service.

errors.name: AuthError
errors.description: Defines the Auth error types that returned from the client.

errors.name: AuthnError
errors.description: Defines the authentication error type that returned from the listener.

errors.name: AuthzError
errors.description: Defines the authorization error type that returned from the listener.

errors.name: ConnectionClosureError
errors.description: Raised during failures in connection closure.

errors.name: ConnectionError
errors.description: Raised during connection failures.

errors.name: Error
errors.description: Represents any error related to the WebSocket module.

errors.name: HandshakeTimedOut
errors.description: Raised when the initial WebSocket handshake timed out.

errors.name: InvalidContinuationFrameError
errors.description: Raised when an out of order/invalid continuation frame is received.

errors.name: InvalidHandshakeError
errors.description: Raised during the handshake when the WebSocket upgrade fails.

errors.name: PayloadTooLargeError
errors.description: Raised when receiving a frame with a payload exceeding the maximum size.

errors.name: ProtocolError
errors.description: Raised when the other side breaks the protocol.

errors.name: ReadTimedOutError
errors.description: Raised when the client read time out reaches.

errors.name: SslError
errors.description: Raised when the SSL handshake fails.

errors.name: UpgradeError
errors.description: Raised when the WebSocket upgrade is not accepted.

Represents OAuth2 password grant configurations for OAuth2 authentication.
Represents OAuth2 refresh token grant configurations for OAuth2 authentication.
Provides inbound request URI, total header and entity body size threshold configurations.
Retry configurations for WebSocket.
